snippet.textDisplay: Im using Windows for about 25 Years now. But since Win 10 grab so much data of users (thats why its free) i had no other choice then switching to linux. I know you guys are Microsoft fanboys, but I would like to see a video on how insecure Windoze is compared to Linux, and do it with all the features turned off, at setup. I think even you will be amazed at the internet traffic with Windoze at idle, or when opening an application not related to the internet.

whois.com

Come on guys, you could do this with one hand tied behind your back, while eating a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.

snippet.textDisplay: As long as you have a valid Windows 7 license you can activate and get rid of the watermark.  I upgraded all of my PCs, 2 were actual upgrades and 2 were clean installs and all of them activated just fine using my current Windows 7 license.  Plus you can turn off the adds and uninstall much of the MS garbage (not all of course) and use Open Office instead of MS Office and Thunderbird instead of Outlook.  Then you have a full functioning PC with all free software.

Then you have a full functioning PC with all free software.

snippet.textDisplay: Find a windows 7 key off an old PC that is being tossed. There is your free windows 10. Also if you get a key finder off a windows 8 computer, this also works. This is if you are going to another computer with it (say a custom build). But if you are staying on an old windows 8 computer. Windows 10 will take the embedded key and use it. And sometimes, windows 10 doesn't care and just activates windows with a digital license, I have no idea why this happens, but I have seen it happen on few computers that I never once put in key in.
snippet.textOriginal: Find a windows 7 key off an old PC that is being tossed. There is your free windows 10. Also if you get a key finder off a windows 8 computer, this also works. This is if you are going to another computer with it (say a custom build). But if you are staying on an old windows 8 computer. Windows 10 will take the embedded key and use it. And sometimes, windows 10 doesn't care and just activates windows with a digital license, I have no idea why this happens, but I have seen it happen on few computers that I never once put in key in.

snippet.textDisplay: So does that mean we can still upgrade Win7 to Win10 for free? Well, if that's how it is, then M$ must have serious reasons to transfer as many users as possible to their newest OS. But I won't take the bait. I'm not gonna tolerate any company forcing me to do things I'm not convinced to do. Besides, I paid for Win7 Pro licence once and legally, that doesn't mean I want to get it upgraded. As long as I can run all my programs and games on it, I don't need any upgrades, even for free. So in short, fuck you M$ and fuck your Windows 10!
snippet.textOriginal: So does that mean we can still upgrade Win7 to Win10 for free? Well, if that's how it is, then M$ must have serious reasons to transfer as many users as possible to their newest OS. But I won't take the bait. I'm not gonna tolerate any company forcing me to do things I'm not convinced to do. Besides, I paid for Win7 Pro licence once and legally, that doesn't mean I want to get it upgraded. As long as I can run all my programs and games on it, I don't need any upgrades, even for free. So in short, fuck you M$ and fuck your Windows 10!

snippet.textDisplay: The cheap, sometimes free windows 8 update worked on pirated editions of windows 7 and upgraded off of them (like Pro--> Pro).  It legitimized them by making the Windows 8 key the only key you needed.  I've only paid $30 between the launch of windows 7 and today for an operating system.
